org.openscience.cdk.config

Class IsotopeFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openscience.cdk.config.IsotopeFactory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Isotopes, XMLIsotopeFactory

    public abstract class IsotopeFactory
extends Object
    Used to store and return data of a particular isotope.
    Author:
    steinbeck
    Source code:
    master
    Belongs to CDK module:
    core
    Created on:
    2001-08-29

      Returns the most abundant (major) isotope whose symbol equals element.
      double getNaturalMass(IElement element)
      Gets the natural mass of this element, defined as average of masses of isotopes, weighted by abundance.

      Returns the number of isotopes defined by this class.

public IIsotope[] getIsotopes(double exactMass,
                                     double difference)
        Gets an array of all isotopes matching the searched exact mass within a certain difference.
        Parameters:
        exactMass - search mass
        difference - mass the isotope is allowed to differ from the search mass
        Returns:
        An array of all isotopes

        exactMass - the mass number
        tolerance - allowed difference from provided exact mass
        Returns:
        the corresponding isotope

      • getMajorIsotope

        @TestMethod(value="testGetMajorIsotope_int")
public IIsotope getMajorIsotope(int atomicNumber)
        Returns the most abundant (major) isotope with a given atomic number.

        The isotope's abundancy is for atoms with atomic number 60 and smaller defined as a number that is proportional to the 100 of the most abundant isotope. For atoms with higher atomic numbers, the abundancy is defined as a percentage.

        Parameters:
        atomicNumber - The atomicNumber for which an isotope is to be returned
        Returns:
        The isotope corresponding to the given atomic number
        See Also:
        getMajorIsotope(String symbol)

        Returns:

      • configure

        @TestMethod(value="testConfigure_IAtom")
public IAtom configure(IAtom atom)
        Configures an atom. Finds the correct element type by looking at the atoms element symbol. If the element symbol is not recognized, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        atom - The atom to be configured
        Returns:
        The configured atom

                              IIsotope isotope)

        Parameters:

        isotope - The isotope to read the data from
